verses.plain: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

tokens.t: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

verses.plain: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

tokens.t: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.

verses.plain: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

tokens.t: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.

verses.plain: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:

tokens.t: Say unto wisdom, Thou
my sister; and call understanding
kinswoman:

verses.plain: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.

tokens.t: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger
flattereth with her words.

verses.plain: ¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

tokens.t: ¶ For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,

verses.plain: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

tokens.t: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,

verses.plain: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

tokens.t: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

verses.plain: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

tokens.t: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:

verses.plain: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

tokens.t: And, behold, there met him a woman
the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

verses.plain: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

tokens.t: (She
loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:

verses.plain: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

tokens.t: Now
without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)

verses.plain: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

tokens.t: So she caught him, and kissed him,
with an impudent face said unto him,

verses.plain: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

tokens.t: peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.

verses.plain: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

tokens.t: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.

verses.plain: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.

tokens.t: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved
, with fine linen of Egypt.

verses.plain: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

tokens.t: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

verses.plain: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

tokens.t: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.

verses.plain: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:

tokens.t: For the goodman
not at home, he is gone a long journey:

verses.plain: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.

tokens.t: He hath taken a bag of money with him,
will come home at the day appointed.

verses.plain: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

tokens.t: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.

verses.plain: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

tokens.t: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;

verses.plain: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.

tokens.t: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it
for his life.

verses.plain: ¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

tokens.t: ¶ Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.

verses.plain: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

tokens.t: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.

verses.plain: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.

tokens.t: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong
have been slain by her.

verses.plain: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

tokens.t: Her house
the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.

footnotes.text: in the evening: Heb. in the evening of days
with…: Heb. she strengthened her face and said
I have…: Heb. Peace offerings are upon me
the day…: or, the new moon
